com.jpmorgan.exercise.market

Class Market

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jpmorgan.exercise.market.Market

  • public class Market
extends java.lang.Object
    Main working class. To provide a "minimal viable product", the Market class implements all the required methods for the exercise. For a larger project, this could be split into two, with the stock information methods moved to a "Broker" class, leaving just the trading and market information methods. Note that, also following the "minimal viable product" paradigm, the assumption has been made that the Market will be accessed by a single thread. I.e. the class is not thread-safe. Synchronization will need to be added to address this, if required later, presumably at the same time as the above move of stock related methods.
    Author:
    Tony Cruickshank

        private static final long HORIZON_WINDOW_SEC
        Hard coded horizon for the calculation of the VWSP/GBCE.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ledger

        private java.util.LinkedList<Trade> ledger
        Ledger of the trades made on the market. Note that, in the current implementation, the ledger is never cleared as offers/bids are not matched.

    • Method Detail

      • MARKET_DATA

        private static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,StockData> MARKET_DATA()
        Hard coded stock information. Using a TreeMap with CASE_INSENSITIVE_ORDER allows access using non-case matching keys.

      • calculateDividendYield

        public double calculateDividendYield(java.lang.String stockIdentifier,
                                     double price)
                              throws InvalidParameterException
        Returns the dividend yield for a stock, by passing through to the stock held by the market.
        Parameters:
        stockIdentifier - Three letter identifier for the stock.
        price - The price to use in the calculation. Must be greater than 0.
        Returns:
        Dividend yield.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - For unrecognised stock identifier or invalid price.

      • recordTrade

        public void recordTrade(java.lang.String stockIdentifier,
                        int quantity,
                        double price,
                        TradeType tradeType)
                 throws InvalidParameterException
        Record a trade, placing it in the ledger.
        Parameters:
        stockIdentifier - Three letter identifier for the stock.
        quantity - The number of stocks in the trade.
        price - The price to use in the calculation. Must be greater than 0.
        tradeType - Buy or sell (currently unused).
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - For unrecognised stock identifier, quantity, or invalid price.

      • calculateVolumeWeightedStockPrice

        public double calculateVolumeWeightedStockPrice(java.lang.String stockIdentifier)
                                         throws InvalidParameterException
        Calculate the volume weighted stock price over a horizon of 5 seconds.
        Parameters:
        stockIdentifier - Three letter identifier for the stock.
        Returns:
        Volume weighted stock price. Note this will be 0 if there are no trades within the horizon.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - For unrecognised stock identifier

      • calculateGBCE

        public double calculateGBCE()
        Calculate the GBCE all share index, using the volume weighted stock price for all stocks traded over a horizon of 5 seconds. Note that double is used for the calculation as for this exercise it's assumed that it provides the necessary range and precision. To increase the range, the calculations below could be modified to use log (changing products to sums, and power roots to multiplications). And/or, use BigDecimal for the calculations.
        Returns:
        GBCE all share index. Note that this will be 0 if there are no trades within the horizon.
